events.name: talk.cs | The .NET Optimization for Beginners
events.description: Hi all .NETters, We're back! Let's have a meetup on November 9th. Not all of us understand or even know how to leverage the tools to optimize .NET projects. In this talk.cs moment, we will be sharing on how you can optimize your .NET projects using the tools you already have or using external tools such as VS extensions. Make your life easier and don't invent the wheel or don't repeat mistake when you coding. And yes, we will talk a bit about Git/GitHub as well. Other than C# coding, let's talk, discuss and we will show on how to optimize .NET projects that connect to the Azure cloud as well. This can be very basic and can be very advanced. But still for beginners! AGENDA SPECIAL GUEST Rita Zhang from Microsoft Corp. (Redmond) will be visiting Singapore. She is one of the Microsoft Open Source Engineer and she wanted to share Microsoft Bot Framework in our community. You don't want to missed it. For those who don't know Rita, check out this Twitter link. Yes that is with Linus Tovalds (Founder and Father of Linux). Riza Marhaban - .NET Optimization (code, logic and performance) for Beginners. Paul Lorett B. Amazona - PowerShell | How I use it in my devices (Raspberry PI - Sense HAT and GrovePi), Arduino, NodeMcu. Keith Tang - NTP (National Trade Platform) by Singapore Customs. A key feature of NTP is developer zone, where developers can build useful apps targeting Singapore and potentially global trading ecosystem, NTP is an open platform and will enable developers to monetize their apps. And guess what, we have a surprise and ONLY ONE big FREE gift from our sponsor JetBrains. Seriously, you will love it. So, make sure you have register and join this meetup as soon as possible. Only in person can received the surprise gift on November 9th. Please join and come! Many thanks for your support and see you on November 9th. Keep on coding... keep on optimizing...! Organizer,Riza
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: How to Source, Build and Be Part of a Product Team
events.description:
RSVP for free here: ga.co/2dGXCxV

Speakers:
Lionel Tan (Senior Product Manager, ZALORA)
Mike Dickinson (Vice President, Product, Ematic Solutions)
Andrius Baranauskas (Director of Product, Carousell)

Join us at a sharing session to discover tips and tricks to building and/or being part of a robust product team! This free event is catered toward hiring managers, company founders and product managers where they'll pick up tips and hiring tactics from industry leaders, improve their knowledge of the industry and connect with others.

events.name: DataJam!
events.description: We're looking to increase our contributions to the social sector here in Singapore, and will be having a monthly meeting for volunteers who want to do more. These will be working sessions which can include:  • DataJams where data is cleaned and prepped for further analysis,  • Clinics for social sector organisations to drop in and ask data-related questions, and • Planning sessions for wider community events.  This is a closed, by-invitation only session for volunteers whom we've worked with before. If we've forgotten you (sorry!) or you're new and have a burning desire to join these sessions, please send us a message! For others who can't make it regularly, these sessions are helping us have more community-wide events. Please understand that no food will be provided, so do make preparations to grab a bite before you turn up. More details to come! Agenda for 9 Nov 6.45 - 7pm: Registration7 - 7.30pm: Data review and task assignment7.30 - 9.30pm: Data cleaning
events.location: #03-04, IDA labs @ National Design Centre,  #03-04, 111 Middle Road, 188969, Singapore

events.name: Elastic night!
events.description: We are delighted to announce our first event at the Singapore Java User Group!  Our first meetup will be about Elasticsearch. Java Clients for Elasticsearch Florian Hopf is based in Germany and will be visiting us in Singapore. He wrote a book on Elasticsearch, blogs on http://blog.florian-hopf.de and has tons of experience on anything that is search-related as well as Java technologies.Florian will walk up through Java clients for Elasticsearch. As communication is based on HTTP and JSON, Elasticsearch can be used with nearly all programming languages. But still, using Elasticsearch with Java is special. The current standard client connects via an internal protocolthat brings some advantages and disadvantages and there are different alternative clients and abstractions.This talk will show you the basics of Elasticsearch and how to choose aclient that suits your needs.  What’s new with Elastic 5?  Matias Cascallares works for Elastic (the company behind Elasticsearch). He is based in Singapore but travels all the time so we feel lucky we’ve been able to catch him for our Elastic night!Elastic 5 has just been released and Matias will take us through all the new features that come with version 5. Sponsors The event will be sponsored by Paypal (venue) and Zenika (food).Zenika is currently recruiting passionate Java and/or Javascript developers. You find out more about it here.
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: Improve your business through Google Analytics
events.description: Making Sense of Data in Google Analytics Don't let data intimidate you! Learn to start with the basic and interpret Google Analytics like a pro!Sign up here : http://bit.ly/2do9Vxd [ Who should join ] 。People who are interested in digital marketing。Aspiring entrepreneurs who want to improve their product and business by data analysis [ What you will learn ] 。The basic setup and interface of Google Analytics。Identify the key metrics for your business。How to make decision by the data you have [ Workshop details ] 。Date: 09 Nov 16。Time: 7.30pm - 9.30pm。Venue: 99 Duxton Road (The Co),[masked]。Price: SGD 15 *Admittance to the workshop is strictly for people who paid for the event only. [ Instructor ] Joe ZhangMarketing Manager, ALPHA Camp Singapore Digital marketing specialist. Google Adwords and Google Analytics certified individual. Built a successful marketing channel for his own business using paid marketing with 400% ROI in 1 year. Passionate about marketing automation and knowledge sharing.____________ Policy:ALPHA Camp reserves the right to cancel or postpone the event due to unforeseen circumstances. In the event that the workshop is cancelled or postponed, all paid participants will be informed via email and full-refund will be given. Thank you!
events.location: Alpha Camp, 43B Tanjong Pagar Road, Singapore
